Wanaplan.name: Wanaplan
Wanaplan.extends:
BaseComponent3D

Component which handle the transformation of object on the scene
Every object's transformation should be executed here

Handle historization and magnetism

Has a special behavior for on-dragging objects :
  Instead of notifying every little step, merge togeter the transformation that occurs inside a beginTransformObject - endTransformObject period

AvatarComponent3D.name: AvatarComponent3D
AvatarComponent3D.description: This component is responsible to add a 3D avatar on the scene.

ConfiguratorModComponent3D.name: ConfiguratorModComponent3D
ConfiguratorModComponent3D.description:
This component is responsible of holding the state of the configurator
state = idle | animationIn | ready | animationOut

listen to event that alter this state
event cycle follow this pattern : 

 wnp.request.configurator.start
           |
 wnp.engine3D.configurator.animationIn.begin
           |
 wnp.engine3D.configurator.animationIn.end
           |
 wnp.engine3D.configurator.start
           |
           |
 wnp.request.configurator.stop
           |
 wnp.engine3D.configurator.stop
           |
 wnp.engine3D.configurator.animationOut.begin
           |
 wnp.engine3D.configurator.animationOut.end
           |
           v

 if the animation component is not present, this component simulate the animationIn|Out event to ensure consistency with others components


 is also responsive of inhibe actions that should not be performed in configurator mode

FloorComponent3D.name: FloorComponent3D
FloorComponent3D.description: This component is responsible for handling the floor mesh containers in 3D.

FloorController.name: FloorController
FloorController.description: A remote control to interact with the floors.

HopperComponent2D.name: HopperComponent2D
HopperComponent2D.description:
Hopper 2D.
Componant which handles
- the actions performed in 2D relative to the hopper. Such as ..
     - adding a hopper
     - displaying the context menu the hopper
     - translating the hopper
     - modifying the shape of the hopper ( moving / adding / removing points )
- the 2D rendering of the hopper

HopperComponent3D.name: HopperComponent3D
HopperComponent3D.description:
Hopper 3D.
Componant which handles :
- the 3D rendering of the hopper.

params.name: points
params.description: The polygon which defines the hopper shape, default is a 100cm large square.

wnp.Programmable.name: wnp.Programmable
wnp.Programmable.description:
Abstract class from which all the programmables inherit.
 A programmable is responsible for exposing the parameters of an object and building the associated mesh.
 A programmable life cycle follows a strict process. See the wiki for more informations (github.com/wanadev/WanaplanAPI/wiki/Object).

DecorationComponent.name: DecorationComponent
DecorationComponent.description: This component manages the decoration of all the objects on the scene.

DragComponent3D.name: DragComponent3D
DragComponent3D.description:
This component is responsible for handling the object moving by drag an drop.
Listen the drag envent, resolve it by detecting the object under the cursor.
When a draggable object is draggend, resolve the new position computation using the projection of the cursor on the scene.
Then apply the move using the transformComponent3D

EditionComponent3D.name: EditionComponent3D
EditionComponent3D.description:
Component managing the user-guided edition of the 3D scene.
Manages all the interactions involving the modifications of the scene's geometry.
Necessary when the scene can be edited by the user.
 > For instance, in viewer mode, this component is inactive.

ObjectComponent3D.name: ObjectComponent3D
ObjectComponent3D.description: Handles the 3D object instanciation for wanaplan.

TransformObjectComponent3D.name: TransformObjectComponent3D

classitems.description:
Matches two sets of RoomStructure to pair those which look alike the most.
This uses a custom (yet perfectible) matching algorithm based on overlapping areas.
classitems.name: identifyRooms

return.description:
An array T such as T[i] = roomj implies :
The room i in the smaller set is the most alike to the roomj in the bigger set.
T length is : ```min(rooms0.length, rooms1.length)```
Example case :
rooms0.length is smaller than rooms1.length : if T[i] = roomj, then the image of rooms0[i] is roomj, and roomj is taken from rooms1.

classitems.description: Computes an animation by given an amnimatable object , source state and destination state, compute the animations babylon way and start play it

params.name: target
params.description: is the animatable object that will be animate

params.name: src
params.description: is a set of property and their value at the begin of the animation

params.name: dst
params.description: is a set of property and their value at the end of the animation

params.name: options
params.description:
An object where :

 - duration               is the animation duration in ms
 - callback               a function to call at the end of the animation
 - cleanAfterAnimation    if true the animation will be cleaned at the end, if set to not, the cancel function MUST be called somewhere ( default is true )
 - name                   name the animation
 - isACamera              if set to true, the event camera.move will be triggered during the animation
 - smooth                 accepted values are linear | ease or a function f x [0:1] -> [0:1]

classitems.name: computeAnimation

return.description: A function that cancel the animation on calling, also make the clean up. This function will be called at the end of the animation if cleanAfterAnimation is true. If cleanAfterAnimation is set to false, this function MUST be called eventually.

classitems.description: Cancels the animation.
classitems.name: cancel

classitems.description:
Starting with version 2.0, this file "boots" Jasmine, performing all of the necessary initialization before executing the loaded environment and all of a project's specs. This file should be loaded after `jasmine.js`, but before any project source files or spec files are loaded. Thus this file can also be used to customize Jasmine for a project.

If a project is using Jasmine via the standalone distribution, this file can be customized directly. If a project is using Jasmine via the [Ruby gem][jasmine-gem], this file can be copied into the support directory via `jasmine copy_boot_js`. Other environments (e.g., Python) will have different mechanisms.

The location of `boot.js` can be specified and/or overridden in `jasmine.yml`.

[jasmine-gem]: http://github.com/pivotal/jasmine-gem

## Require & Instantiate

Require Jasmine's core files. Specifically, this requires and attaches all of Jasmine's code to the `jasmine` reference.
Since this is being run in a browser and the results should populate to an HTML page, require the HTML-specific Jasmine code, injecting the same reference.
Create the Jasmine environment. This is used to run all specs in a project.

## The Global Interface

Build up the functions that will be exposed as the Jasmine public interface. A project can customize, rename or alias any of these functions as desired, provided the implementation remains unchanged.

Add all of the Jasmine global/public interface to the proper global, so a project can use the public interface directly. For example, calling `describe` in specs instead of `jasmine.getEnv().describe`.
Expose the interface for adding custom equality testers.
Expose the interface for adding custom expectation matchers
Expose the mock interface for the JavaScript timeout functions

## Runner Parameters

More browser specific code - wrap the query string in an object and to allow for getting/setting parameters from the runner user interface.

## Reporters
The `HtmlReporter` builds all of the HTML UI for the runner page. This reporter paints the dots, stars, and x's for specs, as well as all spec names and all failures (if any).
The `jsApiReporter` also receives spec results, and is used by any environment that needs to extract the results  from JavaScript.
Filter which specs will be run by matching the start of the full name against the `spec` query param.
Setting up timing functions to be able to be overridden. Certain browsers (Safari, IE 8, phantomjs) require this hack.

## Execution

Replace the browser window's `onload`, ensure it's called, and then run all of the loaded specs. This includes initializing the `HtmlReporter` instance and then executing the loaded Jasmine environment. All of this will happen after all of the specs are loaded.
Helper function for readability above.
